alert.note: Alert for Bay (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 12 at 4:04AM EDT until October 12 at 9:00AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Panhandle Florida, including the following county, Bay. * WHEN...Until 615 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 303 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Multiple weatherstem and ambient stations in Bay County have reported amounts of 3 inches dating back to yesterday. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Panama City, Lynn Haven, Panama City Beach, Springfield, Hiland Park, Tyndall Air Force Base, Magnolia Beach, Biltmore Beach, St Andrews State Park, Gulf Lagoon Beach, Dirego Park, West Panama City, Millville, Cedar Grove, Edgewater Gulf Beach, Beacon Beach, Bahama Beach, Brannonville and Bid-a- Wee. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
